page.title: 02LANDSCAPE OF BRIDGE OF EARN
page.content: { The River Earn flows in meander loops through its flood plain which is about 3kms wide.To the north is the volcanic outcrop of Moncreiffe Hill which has cliffs facing south.The highest point is Mordun Top at 221metres. Glaciers widened the valley and the receding ice deposited till in the form of drumlins and kame terraces against the edge of the hill. The valley shows two levels of river terraces giving evidence of changes in land and sea levels and the position of former meander loops can be seen clearly marked by levees.The lower flood plain is completely flat and is therefore very difficult to drain and liable to flood.
